answers.q: how to refill a butane lighter
answers.a: E943A (butane) is approved as a food-grade propellant for aerosol foods, not for refilling lighters. Use appliance-grade butane and follow the lighter manufacturer’s instructions—do not use food-propellant butane cans.

answers.q: how to fill a butane lighter
answers.a: The E-number E943A refers to butane used as a propellant in food aerosols, not for lighter refills. For filling a lighter, consult the device manual and use the correct fuel-grade butane; butane is highly flammable.
E943A covers butane’s role as a food additive propellant only and isn’t intended for refilling lighters. Follow your lighter’s instructions and use lighter-fuel butane, not food-propellant gas.
As a food additive, E943A (butane) serves as a propellant in aerosol foods and shouldn’t be used to refill lighters. Use appropriate lighter-fuel butane and follow manufacturer safety guidance.
E943A denotes butane’s use as a food propellant, not as torch fuel. For torches, use the specified appliance-grade butane and follow the torch manufacturer’s refilling and safety instructions.
